result.execSummary:
The defendant Syris Thomas Birkley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Syris Thomas Birkley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:    09-19-2014              Initials:  AAC

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Adam C. Essling.  Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also appearing for Department of Corrections, Agent Timothy Kubiszewski.
The State is requesting that the Court lift the stay as to Count 2 as the defendant was tested the day after sentencing (July 25, 2014) and had a BAC of .12.  Agent Kubiszewski states that the deparment will be commencing revocation proceedings once a prior sentence is completed.
THE COURT ORDERS THE STAY LIFTED AS TO COUNT 2 and orders the defendant to serve 6 months House of Correction, straight time, concurrent with any other sentence.
Review date of 12-18-2014 is vacated.

ADA Karshen contacted the court and requested a review hearing date be placed on the calendar.  She has notified defense counsel of the same.  Case scheduled for review hearing on 08/01/2014 at 8:15am.  State will notify defense counsel of this court date.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Adam C. Essling.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim notification.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.
As to count 1:  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction; credit for 0 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-AODA assessment and any treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Random urine screens.
-No contact with the victim, MS dob 6-18-1998.
-Maintain employment or full-time schooling.
-Other counseling needs to be determined. WISER CHOICE
- Pay victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and all costs, assessments.
-Provide DNA sample and pay costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN CIVIL JUDGMENT.
As to count 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, STAYED FOR REVIEW ON 12-18-2014 at 8:15.  The Court directs that if ANY violations or infractions revocation proceedings should be commenced.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.

As to both of the counts:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of AMENDED charges and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Case is adjourned to 7-24-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Adam C. Essling.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2 counts of Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3m), Class A misdemeanors.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are continuing negotiations and requesting another final pretrial on 7-9-2014.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DNA results were received last week.  Counsels are requesting another final pretrial on 6-25-2014.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motion to adjourn jury trial on 6-18-2014 due to officers on vacation is not objected to by defense.
Crime Lab results, as this is a cold hit case, are expected in 2-3 weeks.  The Court will grant the adjournement.    Case set for final pretrial on 6-2-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-14-2014 at 8:15am.
to Adjourn Jury Trial filed by the State.
Case set for final pretrial on 5-5-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-18-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Adam C. Essling.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written Stipulation and Order for substitution of counsel signed by the Court.  Atty Essling is now counsel of record.  Atty Epps has turned over discovery to Atty Essling.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MCS DOB 6/18/98.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-11-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
